get.summary: Get your projects.

parameters.name: description

parameters.name: domainId

parameters.name: classificationType
parameters.description: The type of classifier to create for this project.

parameters.name: targetExportPlatforms
parameters.description: List of platforms the trained model is intending exporting to.

get.summary: Get a specific project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The id of the project to get.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The id of the project to update.

parameters.name: updatedProject
parameters.description: The updated project model.

get.summary: Get artifact content from blob storage, based on artifact relative path in the blob.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The relative path for artifact.

get.summary: Exports a project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id of the project to export.

get.summary: Get images for a given project iteration or workspace.
get.description:
This API supports batching and range selection. By default it will only return first 50 images matching images.
Use the {take} and {skip} parameters to control how many images to return in a given batch.
The filtering is on an and/or relationship. For example, if the provided tag ids are for the "Dog" and
"Cat" tags, then only images tagged with Dog and/or Cat will be returned

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The iteration id. Defaults to workspace.

parameters.name: tagIds
parameters.description: A list of tags ids to filter the images. Defaults to all tagged images when null. Limited to 20.

parameters.name: taggingStatus
parameters.description: The tagging status filter. It can be 'All', 'Tagged', or 'Untagged'. Defaults to 'All'.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
An expression to filter the images against image metadata. Only images where the expression evaluates to true are included in the response.
The expression supports eq (Equal), ne (Not equal), and (Logical and), or (Logical or) operators.
Here is an example, metadata=key1 eq 'value1' and key2 ne 'value2'.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The ordering. Defaults to newest.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Maximum number of images to return. Defaults to 50, limited to 256.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of images to skip before beginning the image batch. Defaults to 0.

post.summary: Add the provided images to the set of training images.
post.description:
This API accepts body content as multipart/form-data and application/octet-stream. When using multipart
multiple image files can be sent at once, with a maximum of 64 files.
If all images are successful created, 200(OK) status code will be returned.
Otherwise, 207 (Multi-Status) status code will be returned and detail status for each image will be listed in the response payload.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: tagIds
parameters.description: The tags ids with which to tag each image. Limited to 20.

parameters.name: imageData
parameters.description: Binary image data. Supported formats are JPEG, GIF, PNG, and BMP. Supports images up to 6MB.

delete.summary: Delete images from the set of training images.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: imageIds
parameters.description: Ids of the images to be deleted. Limited to 256 images per batch.

parameters.name: allImages
parameters.description: Flag to specify delete all images, specify this flag or a list of images. Using this flag will return a 202 response to indicate the images are being deleted.

parameters.name: allIterations
parameters.description: Removes these images from all iterations, not just the current workspace. Using this flag will return a 202 response to indicate the images are being deleted.

post.summary: Get region proposals for an image. Returns empty array if no proposals are found.
post.description: This API will get region proposals for an image along with confidences for the region. It returns an empty array if no proposals are found.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: imageId
parameters.description: The image id.

get.summary: Get the number of images.
get.description:
The filtering is on an and/or relationship. For example, if the provided tag ids are for the "Dog" and
"Cat" tags, then only images tagged with Dog and/or Cat will be returned

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The iteration id. Defaults to workspace.

parameters.name: taggingStatus
parameters.description: The tagging status filter. It can be 'All', 'Tagged', or 'Untagged'. Defaults to 'All'.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
An expression to filter the images against image metadata. Only images where the expression evaluates to true are included in the response.
The expression supports eq (Equal), ne (Not equal), and (Logical and), or (Logical or) operators.
Here is an example, metadata=key1 eq 'value1' and key2 ne 'value2'.

parameters.name: tagIds
parameters.description: A list of tags ids to filter the images to count. Defaults to all tags when null.

post.summary: Add the provided batch of images to the set of training images.
post.description:
This API accepts a batch of files, and optionally tags, to create images. There is a limit of 64 images and 20 tags.
If all images are successful created, 200(OK) status code will be returned.
Otherwise, 207 (Multi-Status) status code will be returned and detail status for each image will be listed in the response payload.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: batch
parameters.description: The batch of image files to add. Limited to 64 images and 20 tags per batch.

get.summary: Get images by id for a given project iteration.
get.description:
This API will return a set of Images for the specified tags and optionally iteration. If no iteration is specified the
current workspace is used.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: imageIds
parameters.description: The list of image ids to retrieve. Limited to 256.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The iteration id. Defaults to workspace.

post.summary: Update metadata of images.
post.description: This API accepts a batch of image Ids, and metadata, to update images. There is a limit of 64 images.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: imageIds
parameters.description: The list of image ids to update. Limited to 64.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: The metadata to be updated to the specified images. Limited to 50 key-value pairs per image. The length of key is limited to 256. The length of value is limited to 512.

post.summary: Add the specified predicted images to the set of training images.
post.description:
This API creates a batch of images from predicted images specified. There is a limit of 64 images and 20 tags.
If all images are successful created, 200(OK) status code will be returned.
Otherwise, 207 (Multi-Status) status code will be returned and detail status for each image will be listed in the response payload.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: batch
parameters.description: Image, tag ids, and metadata. Limited to 64 images and 20 tags per batch.

post.summary: Create a set of image regions.
post.description:
This API accepts a batch of image regions, and optionally tags, to update existing images with region information.
There is a limit of 64 entries in the batch.
If all regions are successful created, 200(OK) status code will be returned.
Otherwise, 207 (Multi-Status) status code will be returned and detail status for each region will be listed in the response payload.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: batch
parameters.description: Batch of image regions which include a tag and bounding box. Limited to 64.

delete.summary: Delete a set of image regions.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: regionIds
parameters.description: Regions to delete. Limited to 64.

post.summary: Get untagged images whose suggested tags match given tags. Returns empty array if no images are found.
post.description: This API will fetch untagged images filtered by suggested tags Ids. It returns an empty array if no images are found.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: IterationId to use for the suggested tags and regions.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Contains properties we need to query suggested images.

post.summary: Get count of images whose suggested tags match given tags and their probabilities are greater than or equal to the given threshold. Returns count as 0 if none found.
post.description: This API takes in tagIds to get count of untagged images per suggested tags for a given threshold.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: IterationId to use for the suggested tags and regions.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Model that contains tagIds, threshold and projectType to query by.

get.summary: Get tagged images for a given project iteration.
get.description:
This API supports batching and range selection. By default it will only return first 50 images matching images.
Use the {take} and {skip} parameters to control how many images to return in a given batch.
The filtering is on an and/or relationship. For example, if the provided tag ids are for the "Dog" and
"Cat" tags, then only images tagged with Dog and/or Cat will be returned

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The iteration id. Defaults to workspace.

parameters.name: tagIds
parameters.description: A list of tags ids to filter the images. Defaults to all tagged images when null. Limited to 20.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The ordering. Defaults to newest.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Maximum number of images to return. Defaults to 50, limited to 256.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of images to skip before beginning the image batch. Defaults to 0.

get.summary: Gets the number of images tagged with the provided {tagIds}.
get.description:
The filtering is on an and/or relationship. For example, if the provided tag ids are for the "Dog" and
"Cat" tags, then only images tagged with Dog and/or Cat will be returned

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The iteration id. Defaults to workspace.

parameters.name: tagIds
parameters.description: A list of tags ids to filter the images to count. Defaults to all tags when null.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: batch
parameters.description: Batch of image tags. Limited to 128 tags per batch.

delete.summary: Remove a set of tags from a set of images.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: imageIds

parameters.name: tagIds
parameters.description: Tags to be deleted from the specified images. Limited to 20 tags.

get.summary: Get untagged images for a given project iteration.
get.description:
This API supports batching and range selection. By default it will only return first 50 images matching images.
Use the {take} and {skip} parameters to control how many images to return in a given batch.

parameters.name: iterationId

get.summary: Gets the number of untagged images.
get.description:
This API returns the images which have no tags for a given project and optionally an iteration. If no iteration is specified the
current workspace is used.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The iteration id. Defaults to workspace.

post.summary: Add the provided images urls to the set of training images.
post.description:
This API accepts a batch of urls, and optionally tags, to create images. There is a limit of 64 images and 20 tags.
If all images are successful created, 200(OK) status code will be returned.
Otherwise, 207 (Multi-Status) status code will be returned and detail status for each image will be listed in the response payload.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: batch
parameters.description: Image urls, tag ids, and metadata. Limited to 64 images and 20 tags per batch.

Use the {take} and {skip} parameters to control how many images to return in a given batch.
The filtering is on an and/or relationship. For example, if the provided tag ids are for the "Dog" and

parameters.description: Binary image data. Supported formats are JPEG, GIF, PNG, and BMP. Supports images up to 6MB.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description:
Optional. Specifies the id of a particular iteration to evaluate against.
            The default iteration for the project will be used when not specified.

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: Optional. Specifies whether or not to store the result of this prediction. The default is true, to store.

post.summary: Suggest tags and regions for an array/batch of untagged images. Returns empty array if no tags are found.
post.description:
This API will get suggested tags and regions for an array/batch of untagged images along with confidences for the tags. It returns an empty array if no tags are found.
There is a limit of 64 images in the batch.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: IterationId to use for tag and region suggestion.

parameters.name: imageIds
parameters.description: Array of image ids tag suggestion are needed for. Use GetUntaggedImages API to get imageIds.

post.summary: Queues project for training.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The project id.

parameters.name: trainingType
parameters.description: The type of training to use to train the project (default: Regular).

parameters.name: reservedBudgetInHours
parameters.description: The number of hours reserved as budget for training (if applicable).

parameters.name: forceTrain
parameters.description: Whether to force train even if dataset and configuration does not change (default: false).

parameters.name: notificationEmailAddress
parameters.description: The email address to send notification to when training finishes (default: null).

parameters.name: trainingParameters
parameters.description: Additional training parameters passed in to control how the project is trained.

post.summary: Imports a project.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Token generated from the export project call.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Optional, name of the project to use instead of auto-generated name.

BoundingBox.description: Bounding box that defines a region of an image.

message.description: A message explaining the error reported by the service.

downloadUri.description: URI used to download the model. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

flavor.description:
Flavor of the export. These are specializations of the export platform.
Docker platform has valid flavors: Linux, Windows, ARM.
Tensorflow platform has valid flavors: TensorFlowNormal, TensorFlowLite.
ONNX platform has valid flavors: ONNX10, ONNX12.

newerVersionAvailable.description: Indicates an updated version of the export package is available and should be re-exported for the latest changes.

Image.description: Image model to be sent as JSON.

resizedImageUri.description: The URI to the (resized) image used for training. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

thumbnailUri.description: The URI to the thumbnail of the original image. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

originalImageUri.description: The URI to the original uploaded image. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

isBatchSuccessful.description: True if all of the images in the batch were created successfully, otherwise false.

images.description: List of the image creation results.

metadata.description: The metadata of image. Limited to 50 key-value pairs per image. The length of key is limited to 256. The length of value is limited to 512.
The metadata of image. Limited to 50 key-value pairs per image. The length of key is limited to 256. The length of value is limited to 512.

ImageMetadataUpdateEntry.description: Entry associating a metadata to an image.

ImagePrediction.description: Result of an image prediction request.

ImageProcessingSettings.description: Represents image preprocessing settings used by image augmentation.

augmentationMethods.description:
Gets or sets enabled image transforms. The key corresponds to the transform name. If value is set to true, then correspondent transform is enabled. Otherwise this transform will not be used.
Augmentation will be uniformly distributed among enabled transforms.

tagId.description: Id of the tag associated with this region.

ImageRegionCreateBatch.description: Batch of image region information to create.

ImageRegionCreateEntry.description: Entry associating a region to an image.

tagId.description: Id of the tag associated with this region.
Id of the tag associated with this region.

tags.description: Image Tag entries to include in this batch.

ImageTagCreateEntry.description: Entry associating a tag to an image.

metadata.description: The metadata of image. Limited to 50 key-value pairs per image. The length of key is limited to 256. The length of value is limited to 512.

Iteration.description: Iteration model to be sent over JSON.

id.description: Gets the id of the iteration.

name.description: Gets or sets the name of the iteration.

created.description: Gets the time this iteration was completed.

lastModified.description: Gets the time this iteration was last modified.

trainedAt.description: Gets the time this iteration was last modified.

projectId.description: Gets the project id of the iteration.

exportable.description: Whether the iteration can be exported to another format for download.

exportableTo.description: A set of platforms this iteration can export to.

domainId.description: Get or sets a guid of the domain the iteration has been trained on.

classificationType.description: Gets the classification type of the project.

trainingType.description: Gets the training type of the iteration.

reservedBudgetInHours.description: Gets the reserved advanced training budget for the iteration.

trainingTimeInMinutes.description: Gets the training time for the iteration.

originalPublishResourceId.description: Resource Provider Id this iteration was originally published to.

IterationPerformance.description: Represents the detailed performance data for a trained iteration.

perTagPerformance.description: Gets the per-tag performance details for this iteration.

precisionStdDeviation.description: Gets the standard deviation for the precision.

recallStdDeviation.description: Gets the standard deviation for the recall.

averagePrecision.description: Gets the average precision when applicable.

PredictionQueryResult.description: Query result of the prediction images that were sent to your prediction endpoint.

results.description: Result of an image prediction request.

name.description: Gets or sets the name of the project.

description.description: Gets or sets the description of the project.

settings.description: Gets or sets the project settings.

created.description: Gets the date this project was created.

lastModified.description: Gets the date this project was last modified.

thumbnailUri.description: Gets the thumbnail url representing the image. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

drModeEnabled.description: Gets if the Disaster Recovery (DR) mode is on, indicating the project is temporarily read-only.

status.description: Gets the status of the project.

ProjectExport.description: Represents information about a project export.

iterationCount.description: Count of iterations that will be exported.

imageCount.description: Count of images that will be exported.

tagCount.description: Count of tags that will be exported.

regionCount.description: Count of regions that will be exported.

estimatedImportTimeInMS.description:
Estimated time this project will take to import, can change based on network connectivity and load between
source and destination regions.

token.description:
Opaque token that should be passed to ImportProject to perform the import. This token grants access to import this
project to all that have the token.

ProjectSettings.description: Represents settings associated with a project.

domainId.description: Gets or sets the id of the Domain to use with this project.

classificationType.description: Gets or sets the classification type of the project.

targetExportPlatforms.description: A list of ExportPlatform that the trained model should be able to support.

useNegativeSet.description: Indicates if negative set is being used.

detectionParameters.description: Detection parameters in use, if any.

imageProcessingSettings.description: Gets or sets image preprocessing settings.

tagId.description: Id of the tag associated with this region.

StoredImagePrediction.description: Result of an image prediction request.

resizedImageUri.description: The URI to the (resized) prediction image. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

thumbnailUri.description: The URI to the thumbnail of the original prediction image. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

originalImageUri.description: The URI to the original prediction image. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

StoredSuggestedTagAndRegion.description: Result of a suggested tags and regions request of the untagged image.

resizedImageUri.description: The URI to the (resized) prediction image. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

thumbnailUri.description: The URI to the thumbnail of the original prediction image. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

originalImageUri.description: The URI to the original prediction image. If VNET feature is enabled this will be a relative path to be used with GetArtifact, otherwise this will be an absolute URI to the resource.

predictionUncertainty.description: Uncertainty (entropy) of suggested tags or regions per image.

SuggestedTagAndRegion.description: Result of a suggested tags and regions request.

predictionUncertainty.description: Uncertainty (entropy) of suggested tags or regions per image.

SuggestedTagAndRegionQuery.description: The array of result images and token containing session and continuation Ids for the next query.

token.description: Contains properties we need to fetch suggested tags for.

results.description: Result of a suggested tags and regions request of the untagged image.

SuggestedTagAndRegionQueryToken.description:
Contains properties we need to fetch suggested tags for. For the first call, Session and continuation set to null.
Then on subsequent calls, uses the session/continuation from the previous SuggestedTagAndRegionQuery result to fetch additional results.

tagIds.description: Existing TagIds in project to filter suggested tags on.

threshold.description: Confidence threshold to filter suggested tags on.

session.description: SessionId for database query. Initially set to null but later used to paginate.

continuation.description: Continuation Id for database pagination. Initially null but later used to paginate.

maxCount.description: Maximum number of results you want to be returned in the response.

sortBy.description: OrderBy. Ordering mechanism for your results.

name.description: Gets or sets the name of the tag.

description.description: Gets or sets the description of the tag.

type.description: Gets or sets the type of the tag.

imageCount.description: Gets the number of images with this tag.

TagFilter.description: Model that query for counting of images whose suggested tags match given tags and their probability are greater than or equal to the given threshold.

tagIds.description: Existing TagIds in project to get suggested tags count for.

threshold.description: Confidence threshold to filter suggested tags on.

TagPerformance.description: Represents performance data for a particular tag in a trained iteration.

precisionStdDeviation.description: Gets the standard deviation for the precision.

recallStdDeviation.description: Gets the standard deviation for the recall.

averagePrecision.description: Gets the average precision when applicable.

selectedTags.description: List of tags selected for this training session, other tags in the project will be ignored.
